snippet: The E.P.A.’s new rule requiring refiners to reduce the sulfur in gasoline by two-thirds is a commendable initiative.
abstract: Editorial praises new rule proposed by Obama administration requiring refiners to reduce the sulfur content in gasoline by two-thirds; points out move will further reduce harmful tailpipe emissions from both old and new cars; contends decision on sulfur bodes well for tough and complex decisions administration faces involving greenhouse gas emissions.
lead_paragraph: The E.P.A.’s new rule requiring refiners to reduce the sulfur in gasoline by two-thirds is a commendable initiative.

headline.main: The Sulfur Rule, Tardy but Welcome
headline.print_headline: The Sulfur Rule, Tardy but Welcome
